ap.name: AP (Armor Piercing)
ap.description: This weapon ignores the target's Armor rating when calculating damage. This makes it particularly effective against heavily armored targets.
ap.example: A weapon with AP will deal full damage even if the target has high Armor

accurate.name: Accurate
accurate.description: This weapon is particularly precise and well-balanced, granting a +2 bonus to hit when making attack rolls.
accurate.example: A weapon with Accurate makes it easier to hit targets

brace.name: Brace
brace.description: This weapon requires a stable firing position. You cannot move and fire this weapon in the same turn unless you have Stabilizers fitted to your mech.
brace.example: Brace weapons require careful positioning for optimal use

inaccurate.name: Inaccurate
inaccurate.description: This weapon is difficult to aim precisely, imposing a -2 penalty to hit when making attack rolls.
inaccurate.example: Inaccurate weapons are harder to hit with but often make up for it in other ways

loading.name: Loading
loading.description: This weapon requires an Action to reload after firing. You cannot fire it again until it has been reloaded.
loading.example: Loading weapons require careful management of your actions

overkill.name: Overkill
overkill.description: When rolling damage for this weapon, if you roll the maximum value on any die, you may reroll that die and add the new result to the total damage.
overkill.example: Overkill weapons can deal massive damage on lucky rolls

reach.name: Reach
reach.description: This weapon can attack targets up to the specified range away. The number after Reach indicates the maximum range in range units.
reach.example: Reach 3 means the weapon can hit targets up to 3 range units away

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: When you hit with this weapon, the target must make a save vs Physical or become Stunned until the end of their next turn. The save DC is equal to the shock value.

smart.name: Smart
smart.description: This weapon has advanced targeting systems. When it hits, the target must make a save vs Tech or take only half damage.
smart.example: Smart weapons are particularly effective against electronic systems

suppressive.name: Suppressive
suppressive.description: This weapon can suppress a 2-range cone, forcing targets in the area to take cover or risk being hit.
suppressive.example: Suppressive weapons are excellent for controlling enemy movement

threat.name: Threat
threat.description: This weapon can be used to make attacks of opportunity against targets that move within its range.
threat.example: Threat weapons can punish enemies for moving carelessly

vigil.name: Vigil
vigil.description: Once per turn, you can immediately attack a hostile that attacked an ally within your weapon's range.
vigil.example: Vigil weapons allow you to protect your allies

blast.name: Blast
blast.description: This weapon deals damage in an area. The number after Blast indicates the radius in range units. All targets in the area must save vs Evasion or take full damage.

cone.name: Cone
cone.description: This weapon creates a cone-shaped area of effect, affecting all targets within the cone's area.
cone.example: Cone weapons are excellent for hitting multiple targets in a specific direction

arcing.name: Arcing
arcing.description: This weapon does not require line of sight to its target, allowing it to hit targets behind cover or around corners.
arcing.example: Arcing weapons can hit targets that would normally be protected by cover

burn.name: Burn
burn.description: This weapon sets targets on fire. On a hit, the target takes ongoing burn damage at the start of their turn until they take an action to put out the flames.
burn.example: Burn weapons can deal damage over time

hex.name: Hex
hex.description: When this weapon hits, the target must make a save vs Tech. On a failure, they become hexxed and suffer a -4 penalty on their next attack.
hex.example: Hex weapons can significantly reduce enemy effectiveness

limited.name: Limited
limited.description: This weapon can only be used a certain number of times per scene. The number after Limited indicates how many uses remain.
limited.example: Limited 3 means the weapon can be used three times per scene

overheat.name: Overheat
overheat.description: When this weapon is fired, the user takes damage equal to the overheat value. This represents the strain on the mech's systems.
overheat.example: Overheat 2 means the mech takes 2 HP damage when firing

quick.name: Quick
quick.description: This fitting can be used as a free action, allowing you to use it without spending your main action.
quick.example: Quick fittings are excellent for tactical flexibility

limited.name: Limited
limited.description: This fitting can only be used a certain number of times per scene. The number after Limited indicates how many uses remain.
limited.example: Limited 3 means the fitting can be used three times per scene

flight.name: Flight
flight.description: This fitting allows the mech to fly. While flying, the mech can move in any direction and ignore terrain obstacles.

jump.name: Jump
jump.description: This fitting allows the mech to make jumping or limited flying movements, with specific limitations on duration or height.
jump.example: Jump fittings provide tactical mobility options

hard_cover.name: Hard Cover
hard_cover.description: This fitting provides hard cover to adjacent allies, giving them a significant defensive bonus.
hard_cover.example: Hard Cover fittings are excellent for protecting allies

soft_cover.name: Soft Cover
soft_cover.description: This fitting provides soft cover to allies within its area of effect, giving them a moderate defensive bonus.
soft_cover.example: Soft Cover fittings can protect multiple allies

immunity.name: Immunity
immunity.description: This fitting makes the mech immune to all damage types, providing complete protection against attacks.

size.name: Size
size.description: This fitting affects the mech's size. The number after Size indicates how many spaces the mech takes up.
size.example: Size 2 means the mech takes up two spaces

tech.name: Tech
tech.description: This system requires targets to make a save vs Tech to resist its effects.
tech.example: Tech systems are particularly effective against electronic systems

physical.name: Physical
physical.description: This system requires targets to make a save vs Physical to resist its effects.
physical.example: Physical systems affect the target's physical capabilities

evasion.name: Evasion
evasion.description: This system requires targets to make a save vs Evasion to resist its effects.
evasion.example: Evasion systems test the target's ability to dodge or avoid effects

mental.name: Mental
mental.description: This system requires targets to make a save vs Mental to resist its effects.
mental.example: Mental systems affect the target's mental state or willpower
